Electrocardiogram (ECG)

An Electrocardiogram (ECG) is a quick, painless test that records the electrical activity of your heart.

What to Expect

  • The test takes 5–10 minutes.
  • 10 small stickers (electrodes) will be placed on your chest, arms, and legs.
    • Please be prepared to provide access to the chest.
  • These electrodes are connected to an ECG machine by wires.
  • You will be asked to relax and stay still while your heart rhythm is recorded.
  • Don’t worry — you won’t feel a thing!
